metadata.title: CVE-2016-1504 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
dhcpcd before 6.10.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(invalid read and crash) via vectors related to the option length.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dhcpcd5 - 6.10.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dhcpcd5 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.10.1-1').
